item.title: Dragging item on mobile also scrolling the parent
item.description: When working with drag and drop library like interactjs, I got a problem with mobile devices. Where scrolling get buggy and moving the parent as well. Here’s how I solved this: Using touch-action: none; CSS property. We add this property to the class of the element we want to drag. For example in interactJS we initialize draggable element like this: interact(`.classname-of-element`).draggable({ .. }) So now in CSS: .classname-of-element { touch-action: none; } Caused: It caused by the default behavior on mobile where touch become a way to scroll an overflow parent element.

item.title: How to use Toast UI Editor in Browser (without NPM)
item.description: Are you looking for great markdown WYSIWYG text editor? Try toast UI Editor, lets see how to use it directly in browser on your HTML file. Install via CDN First, we load the Javascript as well as the CSS via UI CDN. By putting the two tags inside head tag. <head> .. <script src="https://uicdn.toast.com/editor/latest/toastui-editor-all.min.js"></script> <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://uicdn.toast.com/editor/latest/toastui-editor.min.css" /> </head> Add Div for the editor <div id="editor"></div> Add script to initialize Toast UI Editor Put this script after before the close body tag.

item.title: Super simple Zoom image vanilla javascript medium like
item.description: I need an ability to zoom images on my site. Luckily I found this javascript plugin by Tholman that very easy to use. The library called “Intense Images” Github Repo Here’s how I use it: Load from CDN <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/lightense-images@1.0.17/dist/lightense.min.js"></script> Assign your elements <script> window.addEventListener('load', function () { Lightense('img'); }, false); </script> Done that’s it! To change only certain element, change your ‘img’ with any elements indicator, either by id, class or tag name.

item.title: Convert string to UUID format in Javascript
item.description: This is how to convert a 32 characters string into UUID format with - dash as separator on each 8 - 4 - 4 - 4 - 12 characters. function insertString(str, index, value) { return str.substr(0, index) + value + str.substr(index); } function converToUUID(str){ _uuid = insertString(_uuid, 8, '-') _uuid = insertString(_uuid, 13, '-') _uuid = insertString(_uuid, 18, '-') _uuid = insertString(_uuid, 23, '-') return _uuid } The idea is we insert a string on each of “X” characters.
